body:
Sorry, didn't make myself clear in the previous comment 🙈 

You can set the content type yourself in the form `data: { type: :json }` and this may eventually fix your problem. For jQuery, `script` and `json` are two different things and it parses it differently. From what I remember for `script` / `js` it expects plain text, for `json` something different.

However, if you can fix it - yay - if not, we can also do it later ✌️

body_text:
Sorry, didn't make myself clear in the previous comment 🙈
You can set the content type yourself in the form data: { type: :json } and this may eventually fix your problem. For jQuery, script and json are two different things and it parses it differently. From what I remember for script / js it expects plain text, for json something different.
However, if you can fix it - yay - if not, we can also do it later ✌️
